name: Sanguinarina nitrica
Relationship: Compare: SANGUIN. TARTARICUM (exophthalmos); MYDRIASIS; dim vision); ARUM TRIPH.; PSORIN.; KAL. BICH.

Respiratory: Short, hacking cough, with expectoration of thick, yellow, sweetish mucus
Dryness and burning in throat and bronchi
Chronic nasal, laryngeal, and bronchial catarrh
Mouth: Ulceration on the side of the tongue
Nose: Post-nasal secretions adherent to nasopharynx, dislodged with difficulty
Small crusts which bleed when removed
Enlarged turbinates at beginning of hypertrophic process
Rawness and soreness in posterior nares
Nostrils plugged with thick, yellow, bloody mucus
Dry and burning nostrils; watery mucus, with pressure over root of nose
Profuse, watery mucus, with burning pain

details: Is of use in polypus of the nose. Acute and chronic catarrh. Acute pharyngitis. (WYETHIA). Smarting and burning in throat and chest especially under sternum. INFLUENZA. Lachrymation, pains in eyes and head, sore scalp; SENSE OF OBSTRUCTION. Chronic follicular pharyngitis. Diseases of rectum
